page.title: 10HOLKHAM PARK
page.content: There is a nine mile wall all the way round the park. A large part of the park has been converted into arable land, but there is still a great area of grazing land. Lord Coke's father left Holkham Hall to his son Edward Coke and retired to South Africa 15 years ago. The park was in a shambles before Edward Coke took over. Holkham is famous for its deer. The most popular crops to be grown on the estate are sugar beet and winter wheat. There are over 800 sheep. When you come into the park you may see that there are a few cattle grids instead of gates to keep the deer in.
